Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above two white lines; exterior: reserved save for pre-firing inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Burnt by smoke in bombing of 1941.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 215)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1865) (phase 2)
